Class AV.Collection

Provides a standard collection class for our sets of models, ordered or unordered. For more information, see the Backbone documentation.


Defined in: av.js.

Class Summary
Constructor Attributes Constructor Name and Description
 
AV.Collection(models, options)
Creates a new instance with the given models and options.
Method Summary
Method Attributes Method Name and Description
 
add(models, options)
Add a model, or list of models to the set.
 
at(index)
Gets the model at the given index.
 
chain()
Proxy to _'s chain.
 
create(model, options)
Creates a new instance of a model in this collection.
<static>  
AV.Collection.extend(instanceProps, classProps)
Creates a new subclass of AV.Collection.
 
fetch(options)
Fetches the default set of models for this collection, resetting the collection when they arrive.
 
get(id)
Gets a model from the set by id.
 
getByCid(cid)
Gets a model from the set by client id.
 
initialize()
Initialize is an empty function by default.
 
pluck(attr)
Plucks an attribute from each model in the collection.
 
remove(models, options)
Remove a model, or a list of models from the set.
 
reset(models, options)
When you have more items than you want to add or remove individually, you can reset the entire set with a new list of models, without firing any `add` or `remove` events.
 
sort(options)
Forces the collection to re-sort itself.
 
toJSON()
The JSON representation of a Collection is an array of the models' attributes.
Class Detail
AV.Collection(models, options)
Creates a new instance with the given models and options. Typically, you will not call this method directly, but will instead make a subclass using AV.Collection.extend.
Parameters:
{Array} models
An array of instances of AV.Object.
{Object} options
An optional object with Backbone-style options. Valid options are:
  • model: The AV.Object subclass that this collection contains.
  • query: An instance of AV.Query to use when fetching items.
  • comparator: A string property name or function to sort by.
See:
AV.Collection.extend
Method Detail
add(models, options)
Add a model, or list of models to the set. Pass **silent** to avoid firing the `add` event for every new model.
Parameters:
models
options
at(index)
Gets the model at the given index.
Parameters:
index
chain()
Proxy to _'s chain. Can't be proxied the same way the rest of the underscore methods are proxied because it relies on the underscore constructor.
create(model, options)
Creates a new instance of a model in this collection. Add the model to the collection immediately, unless `wait: true` is passed, in which case we wait for the server to agree.
Parameters:
model
options
<static> {Class} AV.Collection.extend(instanceProps, classProps)
Creates a new subclass of AV.Collection. For example,
  var MyCollection = AV.Collection.extend({
    // Instance properties

    model: MyClass,
    query: MyQuery,

    getFirst: function() {
      return this.at(0);
    }
  }, {
    // Class properties

    makeOne: function() {
      return new MyCollection();
    }
  });

  var collection = new MyCollection();
Parameters:
{Object} instanceProps
Instance properties for the collection.
{Object} classProps
Class properies for the collection.
Returns:
{Class} A new subclass of AV.Collection.
fetch(options)
Fetches the default set of models for this collection, resetting the collection when they arrive. If `add: true` is passed, appends the models to the collection instead of resetting.
Parameters:
options
get(id)
Gets a model from the set by id.
Parameters:
id
getByCid(cid)
Gets a model from the set by client id.
Parameters:
cid
initialize()
Initialize is an empty function by default. Override it with your own initialization logic.
pluck(attr)
Plucks an attribute from each model in the collection.
Parameters:
attr
remove(models, options)
Remove a model, or a list of models from the set. Pass silent to avoid firing the remove event for every model removed.
Parameters:
models
options
reset(models, options)
When you have more items than you want to add or remove individually, you can reset the entire set with a new list of models, without firing any `add` or `remove` events. Fires `reset` when finished.
Parameters:
models
options
sort(options)
Forces the collection to re-sort itself. You don't need to call this under normal circumstances, as the set will maintain sort order as each item is added.
Parameters:
options
toJSON()
The JSON representation of a Collection is an array of the models' attributes.
